welcome.title: Hi, I'm Cline
welcome.description: I can do all kinds of tasks thanks to breakthroughs in Claude 4 Sonnet's agentic coding capabilities and access to tools that let me create & edit files, explore complex projects, use a browser, and execute terminal commands (with your permission, of course). I can even use MCP to create new tools and extend my own capabilities.
welcome.subDescription: Sign up for an account to get started for free, or use an API key that provides access to models like Claude Sonnet.

quickWins.title: Quick [Wins] with Cline
quickWins.nextjsDesc: Create a beautiful notetaking app with Next.js and Tailwind
quickWins.cliDesc: Develop a powerful terminal CLI to automate a cool task
quickWins.gameDesc: Code a classic Snake game that runs in the browser.

chat.whatCanIDo: What can I do for you?
chat.infoTooltip: I can develop software step-by-step by editing files, exploring projects, running commands, and using browsers. I can even extend my capabilities with MCP tools to assist beyond basic code completion.
chat.inputHint: Type @ for context, / for slash commands & workflows, hold shift to drag in files/images
chat.errorUnsupportedFile: Files other than images are currently disabled
chat.modeActionPlan: gather information to architect a plan

chatRow.wantsToExecute: Cline wants to execute this command:
chatRow.wantsToUseTool: Cline wants to use a tool
chatRow.wantsToAccessResource: Cline wants to access a resource
chatRow.outsideWorkspace: This file is outside of your workspace
chatRow.creatingPatches: Cline is creating patches to edit this file:
chatRow.wantsToEdit: Cline wants to edit this file:
chatRow.wantsToDelete: Cline wants to delete this file:
chatRow.wantsToCreate: Cline wants to create a new file:
chatRow.wantsToRead: Cline wants to read this file:
chatRow.wantsToViewTopLevel: Cline wants to view the top level files in this directory:
chatRow.viewedTopLevel: Cline viewed the top level files in this directory:
chatRow.wantsToViewRecursive: Cline wants to recursively view all files in this directory:
chatRow.viewedRecursive: Cline recursively viewed all files in this directory:
chatRow.wantsToViewDefinitions: Cline wants to view source code definition names used in this directory:
chatRow.viewedDefinitions: Cline viewed source code definition names used in this directory:
chatRow.wantsToSearch: Cline wants to search this directory for
chatRow.wantsToFetch: Cline wants to fetch content from this URL:
chatRow.fetched: Cline fetched content from this URL:
chatRow.wantsToSearchWeb: Cline wants to search the web for:
chatRow.terminalStopInfo: This command is running in the VSCode terminal. You can manually stop it using Ctrl+C in the terminal, or switch to Background Execution mode in settings for cancellable commands.
chatRow.explicitApproval: The model has determined this command requires explicit approval.
chatRow.shellIntegrationWarning: Cline may have trouble viewing the command's output. Please update VSCode (CMD/CTRL + Shift + P â†’ "Update") and make sure you're using a supported shell: zsh, bash, fish, or PowerShell (CMD/CTRL + Shift + P â†’ "Terminal: Select Default Profile").
chatRow.autoRetryFailedAttempts: Auto-retry failed after {{maxAttempts}} attempts. Manual intervention required.
chatRow.shellIntegrationSuggestion: Since you're experiencing repeated shell integration issues, we recommend switching to Background Terminal mode for better reliability.
chatRow.wantsToStartNewTask: Cline wants to start a new task:
chatRow.wantsToCondense: Cline wants to condense your conversation:
chatRow.wantsToCreateGithubIssue: Cline wants to create a Github issue:
chatRow.wantsToUseSubagent: Cline wants to use a subagent:
chatRow.powershellIssues: It seems like you're having Windows PowerShell issues, please see this
chatRow.diffErrorNoMatch: The model used search patterns that don't match anything in the file. Retrying...
chatRow.clineIgnoreError: Cline tried to access {{path}} which is blocked by the .clineignore file.
chatRow.restoreAllTooltip: Restore both the chat and workspace files to this checkpoint and send your edited message
chatRow.restoreChatTooltip: Restore just the chat to this checkpoint and send your edited message

general.remoteConfigManaged: This setting is managed by your organization's remote configuration
general.telemetryDescription: Help improve Cline by sending usage data and error reports. No code, prompts, or personal information are ever sent. See our {{telemetryLink}} and {{privacyLink}} for more details.
general.preferredLanguageDescription: The language that Cline should use for communication.

terminal.defaultProfileDescription: Select the default terminal Cline will use. 'Default' uses your VSCode global setting.
terminal.timeoutDescription: Set how long Cline waits for shell integration to activate before executing commands. Increase this value if you experience terminal connection timeouts.
terminal.aggressiveReuseDescription: When enabled, Cline will reuse existing terminal windows that aren't in the current working directory. Disable this if you experience issues with task lockout after a terminal command.
terminal.executionModeDescription: Choose whether Cline runs commands in the VS Code terminal or a background process.
terminal.outputLimitDescription: Maximum number of lines to include in terminal output when executing commands. When exceeded, lines will be removed from the middle, saving tokens.

browser.disableToolUseDescription: Prevent Cline from using browser actions (e.g. launch, click, type).
browser.viewportSizeDescription: Set the size of the browser viewport for screenshots and interactions.
browser.remoteConnectionDescription: Enable Cline to use your Chrome {{chromePathInfo}}. You can specify a custom path below. Using a remote browser connection requires starting Chrome in debug mode {{debugModeInfo}}.
browser.debugModeManual: manually (--remote-debugging-port=9222) or using the button below. Enter the host address or leave it blank for automatic discovery.
browser.customArgsDescription: Space-separated arguments to pass to the browser executable.

features.subagentsDescription: Cline for CLI is required for subagents. Install it with: {{installCmd}}, then run {{authCmd}} To authenticate with Cline or configure an API provider.
features.subagentsExplanation: Allows Cline to spawn subprocesses to handle focused tasks like exploring large codebases, keeping your main context clean.
features.checkpointsDescription: Enables extension to save checkpoints of workspace throughout the task. Uses git under the hood which may not work well with large workspaces.
features.mcpDisplayModeDescription: Controls how MCP responses are displayed: plain text, rich formatting with links/images, or markdown rendering.
features.collapseMcpResponsesDescription: Sets the default display mode for MCP response panels
features.openaiReasoningEffortDescription: Reasoning effort for the OpenAI family of models(applies to all OpenAI model providers)
features.strictPlanModeDescription: Enforces strict tool use while in plan mode, preventing file edits.
features.focusChainDescription: Enables enhanced task progress tracking and automatic focus chain list management throughout tasks.
features.focusChainReminderIntervalDescription: Interval (in messages) to remind Cline about its focus chain checklist (1-100). Lower values provide more frequent reminders.
features.dictationDescription: Enables speech-to-text transcription using your Cline account. Uses the Aqua Voice's Avalon model, at $0.0065 credits per minute of audio processed. 5 minutes max per message.
features.autoCompactDescription: Enables advanced context management system which uses LLM based condensing for next-gen models. {{learnMore}}
features.webToolsDescription: Enables websearch and webfetch tools while using the Cline provider.
features.nativeToolCallDescription: Uses the model's native tool calling API instead of XML-based tool parsing. This will improve performance for supported models.
features.parallelToolCallingDescription: Allows models to call multiple tools in a single response. Automatically enabled for GPT-5 models.
features.backgroundEditDescription: Allows editing files in background without opening the diff view in editor.
features.multiRootDescription: Allows cline to work across multiple workspaces.
features.hooksNotSupportedWindows: Hooks are not yet supported on Windows. This feature is currently available on macOS and Linux only.
features.hooksDescription: Allows execution of hooks from .clinerules/hooks/ directory.
features.yoloDescription: EXPERIMENTAL & DANGEROUS: This mode disables safety checks and user confirmations. Cline will automatically approve all actions without asking. Use with extreme caution.
features.subagentOutputLimitDescription: Maximum number of lines to include in output from CLI subagents. Truncates middle to save tokens.

about.description: An AI assistant that can use your CLI and Editor. Cline can handle complex software development tasks step-by-step with tools that let him create & edit files, explore large projects, use the browser, and execute terminal commands (after you grant permission).

debug.resetGlobalDescription: This will reset all global state and secret storage in the extension.

apiConfig.remoteConfigManaged: Provider options are managed by your organization's remote configuration
apiConfig.separateModels: Use different models for Plan and Act modes
apiConfig.separateModelsDescription: Switching between Plan and Act mode will persist the API and model used in the previous mode. This may be helpful e.g. when using a strong reasoning model to architect a plan for a cheaper coding model to act on.

providerHelpText.lmstudio: Start LM Studio and load a model to begin
providerHelpText.ollama: Run `ollama serve` and pull a model
providerHelpText.litellm: Add your LiteLLM proxy URL in settings
providerHelpText.openai: Add your OpenAI API key and endpoint
providerHelpText.vscode-lm: Select a VS Code language model from settings
providerHelpText.requesty: Add your Requesty API key in settings
providerHelpText.together: Add your Together AI API key in settings
providerHelpText.dify: Configure your Dify workflow URL and API key
providerHelpText.hicap: Add your HiCap API key in settings
providerHelpText.oca: Configure your OCA endpoint in settings
providerHelpText.aihubmix: Add your AIHubMix API key in settings
providerHelpText.default: Configure this provider in model settings

providers.vertexDescription: To use Google Cloud Vertex AI, you need to {{step1}} and {{step2}}
providers.vertexStep1: 1) create a Google Cloud account â€º enable the Vertex AI API â€º enable the desired Claude models,
providers.vertexStep2: 2) install the Google Cloud CLI â€º configure Application Default Credentials.

marketplace.remoteConfigManaged: Your organization has pre-configured the available MCP servers
marketplace.noServersFound: No MCP servers found in the marketplace

submit.title: Submit MCP Server
submit.description: Help others discover great MCP servers by submitting an issue to

configure.description: The {{mcpLink}} enables communication with locally running MCP servers that provide additional tools and resources to extend Cline's capabilities. You can use {{communityServersLink}} or ask Cline to create new tools specific to your workflow (e.g., "add a tool that gets the latest npm docs").

addLocalServer.description: Add a new local MCP server by providing a name, command, and its arguments. Learn more

addRemoteServer.description: Add a remote MCP server by providing a name and its URL endpoint. Learn more

userType.title: How will you use Cline?
userType.description: Select an option below to get started.

byok.title: Bring my own API key
byok.description: Use Cline with your provider of choice

almost.title: Almost there!
almost.description: Complete account creation in your browser. Then come back here to finish up.

footer.changeLater: You can change this later in settings

welcome.description: Sign up for an account to get access to the latest models, billing dashboard to view usage and credits, and more upcoming features.
welcome.tosAgreement: By continuing, you agree to the

view.title: Account
view.lockedByRemoteConfig: This cannot be changed while your organization has remote configuration enabled.

infoBanner.title: ðŸ’¡ Cline in the Right Sidebar
infoBanner.description: Keep your files visible when chatting with Cline. Drag the Cline icon to the right sidebar panel for a better experience.

rightSidebar.title: Use Cline in Right Sidebar
rightSidebar.description: For the best experience, drag the Cline icon to your right sidebar. This keeps your file explorer and editor visible while you chat with Cline, making it easier to navigate your codebase and see changes in real-time. [See how â†’](https://docs.cline.bot/features/customization/opening-cline-in-sidebar)

opus45ClineUsers.title: Claude Opus 4.5 Now Available
opus45ClineUsers.description: State-of-the-art performance at 3x lower cost than Opus 4.1. Available now in the Cline provider.

opus45NonClineUsers.title: Claude Opus 4.5 Now Available
opus45NonClineUsers.description: State-of-the-art performance at 3x lower cost than Opus 4.1. Available now in the Cline provider.

cliInstallUnix.title: CLI & Subagents Available
cliInstallUnix.description: Use Cline in your terminal and enable subagent capabilities. [Learn more](https://docs.cline.bot/cline-cli/overview)

cliInfoWindows.title: Cline CLI Info
cliInfoWindows.description: Available for macOS and Linux. Coming soon to other platforms. [Learn more](https://docs.cline.bot/cline-cli/overview)

cliInstallBanner.descriptionUnix: Install to use Cline directly in your terminal and enable subagent capabilities. Cline can spawn cline commands to handle focused tasks like exploring large codebases for information. This keeps your main context window clean by running these operations in separate subprocesses.
cliInstallBanner.descriptionWindows: Cline CLI is available for macOS and Linux! Coming soon to other platforms.
cliInstallBanner.subagentsWindowsTooltip: Cline CLI & subagents are only available on macOS & Linux

modal.description: Let Cline take these actions without asking for approval.

notification.message: An auto-approved command has been running for 30s, and may need your attention.

descriptions.rules: Rules allow you to provide Cline with system-level guidance. Think of them as a persistent way to include context and preferences for your projects or globally for every conversation.
descriptions.workflows: Workflows allow you to define a series of steps to guide Cline through a repetitive set of tasks, such as deploying a service or submitting a PR. To invoke a workflow, type
descriptions.hooks: Hooks allow you to execute custom scripts at specific points in Cline's execution lifecycle, enabling automation and integration with external tools.

ruleRow.ruleRequired: This rule is required and cannot be disabled

hooks.windowsWarning: Hook toggling is not supported on Windows. Hooks can be created, edited, and deleted, but cannot be enabled/disabled and will not execute.
hooks.windowsTooltip: Hook toggling not supported on Windows. Hooks can be edited and deleted, but won't execute.
hooks.chooseHookType: Choose a hook type to create. Hooks execute at specific points in Cline's lifecycle. Available:
hooks.agentsInfo: Searches recursively for all AGENTS.md files in the workspace when a top-level AGENTS.md exists

newRuleRow.invalidExtension: Only .md, .txt, or no file extension allowed
